scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.

line: The danger of the task you undertake.

line: I have, Antiochus, and, with a soul

speaker: PERICLES
line: Embolden'd with the glory of her praise,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Think death no hazard in this enterprise.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Bring in our daughter, clothed like a bride,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.

line: For the embracements even of Jove himself;

line: At whose conception, till Lucina reign'd,

line: Nature this dowry gave, to glad her presence,

line: The senate-house of planets all did sit,

line: To knit in her their best perfections.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: See where she comes, apparell'd like the spring,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Graces her subjects, and her thoughts the king

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Of every virtue gives renown to men!

speaker: PERICLES

speaker: PERICLES
line: Nothing but curious pleasures, as from thence

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.

speaker: PERICLES

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: You gods that made me man, and sway in love,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: That have inflamed desire in my breast

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: To taste the fruit of yon celestial tree,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Or die in the adventure, be my helps,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: As I am son and servant to your will,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: To compass such a boundless happiness!

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Prince Pericles,--

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: That would be son to great Antiochus.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Before thee stands this fair Hesperides,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: With golden fruit, but dangerous to be touch'd;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: For death-like dragons here affright thee hard:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Her face, like heaven, enticeth thee to view

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Her countless glory, which desert must gain;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: And which, without desert, because thine eye

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Presumes to reach, all thy whole heap must die.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Yon sometimes famous princes, like thyself,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Drawn by report, adventurous by desire,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Tell thee, with speechless tongues and semblance pale,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: That without covering, save yon field of stars,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Here they stand martyrs, slain in Cupid's wars;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: And with dead cheeks advise thee to desist

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: For going on death's net, whom none resist.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Antiochus, I thank thee, who hath taught

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: My frail mortality to know itself,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And by those fearful objects to prepare

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: This body, like to them, to what I must;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: For death remember'd should be like a mirror,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Who tells us life's but breath, to trust it error.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I'll make my will then, and, as sick men do

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Who know the world, see heaven, but, feeling woe,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Gripe not at earthly joys as erst they did;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: So I bequeath a happy peace to you

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And all good men, as every prince should do;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: My riches to the earth from whence they came;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: But my unspotted fire of love to you.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Thus ready for the way of life or death,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I wait the sharpest blow, Antiochus.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Scorning advice, read the conclusion then:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Which read and not expounded, 'tis decreed,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: As these before thee thou thyself shalt bleed.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: Daughter
line: Of all say'd yet, mayst thou prove prosperous!

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: Daughter
line: Of all say'd yet, I wish thee happiness!

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Like a bold champion, I assume the lists,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Nor ask advice of any other thought

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: But faithfulness and courage.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I am no viper, yet I feed

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: On mother's flesh which did me breed.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I sought a husband, in which labour

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I found that kindness in a father:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: He's father, son, and husband mild;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I mother, wife, and yet his child.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: How they may be, and yet in two,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: As you will live, resolve it you.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Sharp physic is the last: but, O you powers

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: That give heaven countless eyes to view men's acts,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Why cloud they not their sights perpetually,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: If this be true, which makes me pale to read it?

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Fair glass of light, I loved you, and could still,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Were not this glorious casket stored with ill:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: But I must tell you, now my thoughts revolt

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: For he's no man on whom perfections wait

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: That, knowing sin within, will touch the gate.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: You are a fair viol, and your sense the strings;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Who, finger'd to make man his lawful music,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Would draw heaven down, and all the gods, to hearken:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: But being play'd upon before your time,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Hell only danceth at so harsh a chime.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Good sooth, I care not for you.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Prince Pericles, touch not, upon thy life.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: For that's an article within our law,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: As dangerous as the rest. Your time's expired:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Either expound now, or receive your sentence.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Great king,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Few love to hear the sins they love to act;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: 'Twould braid yourself too near for me to tell it.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Who has a book of all that monarchs do,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: He's more secure to keep it shut than shown:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: For vice repeated is like the wandering wind.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Blows dust in other's eyes, to spread itself;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And yet the end of all is bought thus dear,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: The breath is gone, and the sore eyes see clear:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: To stop the air would hurt them. The blind mole casts

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Copp'd hills towards heaven, to tell the earth is throng'd

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.

line: By man's oppression; and the poor worm doth die for't.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Kings are earth's gods; in vice their law's

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: their will;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And if Jove stray, who dares say Jove doth ill?

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: It is enough you know; and it is fit,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: What being more known grows worse, to smother it.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: All love the womb that their first being bred,

line: Then give my tongue like leave to love my head.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Aside  Heaven, that I had thy head! he has found

line: the meaning:

speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: But I will gloze with him.--Young prince of Tyre,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Though by the tenor of our strict edict,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Your exposition misinterpreting,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: We might proceed to cancel of your days;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Yet hope, succeeding from so fair a tree

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.

line: As your fair self, doth tune us otherwise:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Forty days longer we do respite you;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: If by which time our secret be undone,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: This mercy shows we'll joy in such a son:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: And until then your entertain shall be

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.

line: As doth befit our honour and your worth.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: How courtesy would seem to cover sin,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: When what is done is like an hypocrite,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: The which is good in nothing but in sight!

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: If it be true that I interpret false,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Then were it certain you were not so bad

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: As with foul incest to abuse your soul;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Where now you're both a father and a son,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: By your untimely claspings with your child,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Which pleasure fits an husband, not a father;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And she an eater of her mother's flesh,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: By the defiling of her parent's bed;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And both like serpents are, who though they feed

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: On sweetest flowers, yet they poison breed.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Antioch, farewell! for wisdom sees, those men

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Blush not in actions blacker than the night,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Will shun no course to keep them from the light.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: One sin, I know, another doth provoke;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Murder's as near to lust as flame to smoke:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Poison and treason are the hands of sin,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Ay, and the targets, to put off the shame:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Then, lest my lie be cropp'd to keep you clear,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: By flight I'll shun the danger which I fear.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: He hath found the meaning, for which we mean

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: To have his head.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: He must not live to trumpet forth my infamy,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Nor tell the world Antiochus doth sin

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: In such a loathed manner;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: And therefore instantly this prince must die:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: For by his fall my honour must keep high.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Who attends us there?

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: Doth your highness call?

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Thaliard,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: You are of our chamber, and our mind partakes

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Her private actions to your secrecy;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: And for your faithfulness we will advance you.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Thaliard, behold, here's poison, and here's gold;

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: We hate the prince of Tyre, and thou must kill him:

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: It fits thee not to ask the reason why,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Because we bid it. Say, is it done?

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: My lord,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: 'Tis done.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Enough.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Let your breath cool yourself, telling your haste.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: Messenger
line: My lord, prince Pericles is fled.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: As thou

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Wilt live, fly after: and like an arrow shot

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: From a well-experienced archer hits the mark

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: His eye doth level at, so thou ne'er return

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Unless thou say 'Prince Pericles is dead.'

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: My lord,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: If I can get him within my pistol's length,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: I'll make him sure enough: so, farewell to your highness.

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Thaliard, adieu!

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: Till Pericles be dead,

scene: SCENE I.  Antioch. A room in the palace.
speaker: ANTIOCHUS
line: My heart can lend no succor to my head.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: To Lords without  Let none disturb us.--Why should

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: this change of thoughts,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: The sad companion, dull-eyed melancholy,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Be my so used a guest as not an hour,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: In the day's glorious walk, or peaceful night,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: The tomb where grief should sleep, can breed me quiet?

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Here pleasures court mine eyes, and mine eyes shun them,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And danger, which I fear'd, is at Antioch,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Whose aim seems far too short to hit me here:

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Yet neither pleasure's art can joy my spirits,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Nor yet the other's distance comfort me.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Then it is thus: the passions of the mind,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: That have their first conception by mis-dread,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Have after-nourishment and life by care;

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And what was first but fear what might be done,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Grows elder now and cares it be not done.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And so with me: the great Antiochus,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: 'Gainst whom I am too little to contend,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Since he's so great can make his will his act,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Will think me speaking, though I swear to silence;

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Nor boots it me to say I honour him.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: If he suspect I may dishonour him:

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And what may make him blush in being known,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: He'll stop the course by which it might be known;

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: With hostile forces he'll o'erspread the land,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And with the ostent of war will look so huge,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Amazement shall drive courage from the state;

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Our men be vanquish'd ere they do resist,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And subjects punish'd that ne'er thought offence:

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Which care of them, not pity of myself,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Who am no more but as the tops of trees,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Which fence the roots they grow by and defend them,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Makes both my body pine and soul to languish,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And punish that before that he would punish.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: First Lord
line: Joy and all comfort in your sacred breast!

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: Second Lord
line: And keep your mind, till you return to us,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Peaceful and comfortable!

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Peace, peace, and give experience tongue.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: They do abuse the king that flatter him:

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: For flattery is the bellows blows up sin;

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: The thing which is flatter'd, but a spark,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: To which that blast gives heat and stronger glowing;

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Whereas reproof, obedient and in order,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Fits kings, as they are men, for they may err.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: When Signior Sooth here does proclaim a peace,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: He flatters you, makes war upon your life.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Prince, pardon me, or strike me, if you please;

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: I cannot be much lower than my knees.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: All leave us else; but let your cares o'erlook

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: What shipping and what lading's in our haven,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And then return to us.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Helicanus, thou

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Hast moved us: what seest thou in our looks?

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: An angry brow, dread lord.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: If there be such a dart in princes' frowns,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: How durst thy tongue move anger to our face?

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: How dare the plants look up to heaven, from whence

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: They have their nourishment?

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Thou know'st I have power

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: To take thy life from thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Kneeling

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: I have ground the axe myself;

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Do you but strike the blow.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Rise, prithee, rise.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Sit down: thou art no flatterer:

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I thank thee for it; and heaven forbid

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: That kings should let their ears hear their

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: faults hid!

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Fit counsellor and servant for a prince,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Who by thy wisdom makest a prince thy servant,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: What wouldst thou have me do?

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: To bear with patience

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Such griefs as you yourself do lay upon yourself.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Thou speak'st like a physician, Helicanus,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: That minister'st a potion unto me

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: That thou wouldst tremble to receive thyself.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Attend me, then: I went to Antioch,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Where as thou know'st, against the face of death,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I sought the purchase of a glorious beauty.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: From whence an issue I might propagate,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Are arms to princes, and bring joys to subjects.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Her face was to mine eye beyond all wonder;

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: The rest--hark in thine ear--as black as incest:

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Which by my knowledge found, the sinful father

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Seem'd not to strike, but smooth: but thou

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: know'st this,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: 'Tis time to fear when tyrants seem to kiss.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Such fear so grew in me, I hither fled,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Under the covering of a careful night,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Who seem'd my good protector; and, being here,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Bethought me what was past, what might succeed.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I knew him tyrannous; and tyrants' fears

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Decrease not, but grow faster than the years:

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And should he doubt it, as no doubt he doth,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: That I should open to the listening air

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: How many worthy princes' bloods were shed,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: To keep his bed of blackness unlaid ope,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: To lop that doubt, he'll fill this land with arms,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And make pretence of wrong that I have done him:

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: When all, for mine, if I may call offence,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Must feel war's blow, who spares not innocence:

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Which love to all, of which thyself art one,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Who now reprovest me for it,--

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Alas, sir!

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Drew sleep out of mine eyes, blood from my cheeks,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Musings into my mind, with thousand doubts

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: How I might stop this tempest ere it came;

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And finding little comfort to relieve them,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I thought it princely charity to grieve them.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Well, my lord, since you have given me leave to speak.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Freely will I speak. Antiochus you fear,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: And justly too, I think, you fear the tyrant,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Who either by public war or private treason

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Will take away your life.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Therefore, my lord, go travel for a while,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Till that his rage and anger be forgot,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Or till the Destinies do cut his thread of life.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Your rule direct to any; if to me.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Day serves not light more faithful than I'll be.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I do not doubt thy faith;

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: But should he wrong my liberties in my absence?

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: We'll mingle our bloods together in the earth,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: From whence we had our being and our birth.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Tyre, I now look from thee then, and to Tarsus

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Intend my travel, where I'll hear from thee;

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And by whose letters I'll dispose myself.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: The care I had and have of subjects' good

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: On thee I lay whose wisdom's strength can bear it.

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I'll take thy word for faith, not ask thine oath:

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Who shuns not to break one will sure crack both:

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: But in our orbs we'll live so round and safe,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: That time of both this truth shall ne'er convince,

scene: SCENE II.  Tyre. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Thou show'dst a subject's shine, I a true prince.

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: So, this is Tyre, and this the court. Here must I

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: kill King Pericles; and if I do it not, I am sure to

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: be hanged at home: 'tis dangerous. Well, I perceive

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: he was a wise fellow, and had good discretion, that,

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: being bid to ask what he would of the king, desired

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: he might know none of his secrets: now do I see he

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: had some reason for't; for if a king bid a man be a

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: villain, he's bound by the indenture of his oath to

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: be one! Hush! here come the lords of Tyre.

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: You shall not need, my fellow peers of Tyre,

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Further to question me of your king's departure:

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: His seal'd commission, left in trust with me,

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Doth speak sufficiently he's gone to travel.

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: Aside  How! the king gone!

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: If further yet you will be satisfied,

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Why, as it were unlicensed of your loves,

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: He would depart, I'll give some light unto you.

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Being at Antioch--

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: Aside          What from Antioch?

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Royal Antiochus--on what cause I know not--

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Took some displeasure at him; at least he judged so:

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: And doubting lest that he had err'd or sinn'd,

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: To show his sorrow, he'ld correct himself;

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: So puts himself unto the shipman's toil,

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: With whom each minute threatens life or death.

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: Aside  Well, I perceive

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: I shall not be hang'd now, although I would;

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: But since he's gone, the king's seas must please:

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: He 'scaped the land, to perish at the sea.

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: I'll present myself. Peace to the lords of Tyre!

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Lord Thaliard from Antiochus is welcome.

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: From him I come

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: With message unto princely Pericles;

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: But since my landing I have understood

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: Your lord has betook himself to unknown travels,

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: THALIARD
line: My message must return from whence it came.

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: We have no reason to desire it,

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Commended to our master, not to us:

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Yet, ere you shall depart, this we desire,

scene: SCENE III.  Tyre. An ante-chamber in the palace.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: As friends to Antioch, we may feast in Tyre.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: My Dionyza, shall we rest us here,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: And by relating tales of others' griefs,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: See if 'twill teach us to forget our own?

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: DIONYZA
line: That were to blow at fire in hope to quench it;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: DIONYZA
line: For who digs hills because they do aspire

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: DIONYZA
line: Throws down one mountain to cast up a higher.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: DIONYZA
line: O my distressed lord, even such our griefs are;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: DIONYZA
line: Here they're but felt, and seen with mischief's eyes,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: DIONYZA
line: But like to groves, being topp'd, they higher rise.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: O Dionyza,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Who wanteth food, and will not say he wants it,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Or can conceal his hunger till he famish?

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Our tongues and sorrows do sound deep

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Our woes into the air; our eyes do weep,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Till tongues fetch breath that may proclaim them louder;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: That, if heaven slumber while their creatures want,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: They may awake their helps to comfort them.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: I'll then discourse our woes, felt several years,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: And wanting breath to speak help me with tears.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: DIONYZA
line: I'll do my best, sir.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: This Tarsus, o'er which I have the government,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: A city on whom plenty held full hand,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: For riches strew'd herself even in the streets;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Whose towers bore heads so high they kiss'd the clouds,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: And strangers ne'er beheld but wondered at;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Whose men and dames so jetted and adorn'd,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Like one another's glass to trim them by:

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Their tables were stored full, to glad the sight,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: And not so much to feed on as delight;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: All poverty was scorn'd, and pride so great,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: The name of help grew odious to repeat.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: DIONYZA
line: O, 'tis too true.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: But see what heaven can do! By this our change,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: These mouths, who but of late, earth, sea, and air,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Were all too little to content and please,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Although they gave their creatures in abundance,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: As houses are defiled for want of use,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: They are now starved for want of exercise:

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Those palates who, not yet two summers younger,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Must have inventions to delight the taste,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Would now be glad of bread, and beg for it:

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Those mothers who, to nousle up their babes,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Thought nought too curious, are ready now

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: To eat those little darlings whom they loved.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: So sharp are hunger's teeth, that man and wife

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Draw lots who first shall die to lengthen life:

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Here stands a lord, and there a lady weeping;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Here many sink, yet those which see them fall

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Have scarce strength left to give them burial.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Is not this true?

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: DIONYZA
line: Our cheeks and hollow eyes do witness it.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: O, let those cities that of plenty's cup

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: And her prosperities so largely taste,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: With their superfluous riots, hear these tears!

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: The misery of Tarsus may be theirs.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Lord
line: Where's the lord governor?

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Here.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Speak out thy sorrows which thou bring'st in haste,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: For comfort is too far for us to expect.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Lord
line: We have descried, upon our neighbouring shore,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Lord
line: A portly sail of ships make hitherward.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: I thought as much.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: One sorrow never comes but brings an heir,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: That may succeed as his inheritor;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: And so in ours: some neighbouring nation,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Taking advantage of our misery,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Hath stuff'd these hollow vessels with their power,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: To beat us down, the which are down already;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: And make a conquest of unhappy me,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Whereas no glory's got to overcome.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Lord
line: That's the least fear; for, by the semblance

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Lord
line: Of their white flags display'd, they bring us peace,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Lord
line: And come to us as favourers, not as foes.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Thou speak'st like him's untutor'd to repeat:

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Who makes the fairest show means most deceit.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: But bring they what they will and what they can,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: What need we fear?

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: The ground's the lowest, and we are half way there.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Go tell their general we attend him here,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: To know for what he comes, and whence he comes,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: And what he craves.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Lord
line: I go, my lord.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Welcome is peace, if he on peace consist;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: If wars, we are unable to resist.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Lord governor, for so we hear you are,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Let not our ships and number of our men

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Be like a beacon fired to amaze your eyes.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: We have heard your miseries as far as Tyre,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And seen the desolation of your streets:

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Nor come we to add sorrow to your tears,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: But to relieve them of their heavy load;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And these our ships, you happily may think

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Are like the Trojan horse was stuff'd within

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: With bloody veins, expecting overthrow,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Are stored with corn to make your needy bread,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And give them life whom hunger starved half dead.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: All
line: The gods of Greece protect you!

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: All
line: And we'll pray for you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Arise, I pray you, rise:

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: We do not look for reverence, but to love,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And harbourage for ourself, our ships, and men.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: The which when any shall not gratify,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Or pay you with unthankfulness in thought,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Be it our wives, our children, or ourselves,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: The curse of heaven and men succeed their evils!

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Till when,--the which I hope shall ne'er be seen,--

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Your grace is welcome to our town and us.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Which welcome we'll accept; feast here awhile,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tarsus. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Until our stars that frown lend us a smile.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Yet cease your ire, you angry stars of heaven!

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Wind, rain, and thunder, remember, earthly man

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Is but a substance that must yield to you;

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And I, as fits my nature, do obey you:

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Alas, the sea hath cast me on the rocks,

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Wash'd me from shore to shore, and left me breath

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Nothing to think on but ensuing death:

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Let it suffice the greatness of your powers

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: To have bereft a prince of all his fortunes;

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And having thrown him from your watery grave,

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Here to have death in peace is all he'll crave.

line: What, ho, Pilch!

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: What, Patch-breech, I say!

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: were cast away before us even now.

line: well-a-day, we could scarce help ourselves.

line: marvel how the fishes live in the sea.

line: Aside  A pretty moral.

line: been that day in the belfry.

line: Aside  Simonides!

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: We would purge the land of these drones, that rob

line: the bee of her honey.

line: Aside  How from the finny subject of the sea

line: These fishers tell the infirmities of men;

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: And from their watery empire recollect

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: All that may men approve or men detect!

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: Peace be at your labour, honest fishermen.

speaker: Second Fisherman
line: Honest! good fellow, what's that? If it be a day

line: fits you, search out of the calendar, and nobody

line: look after it.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: May see the sea hath cast upon your coast.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: Second Fisherman
line: What a drunken knave was the sea to cast thee in our

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: Second Fisherman
line: way!

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: A man whom both the waters and the wind,

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: In that vast tennis-court, have made the ball

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: For them to play upon, entreats you pity him:

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: He asks of you, that never used to beg.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: First Fisherman
line: No, friend, cannot you beg? Here's them in our

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: First Fisherman
line: country Greece gets more with begging than we can do

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: First Fisherman
line: with working.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: Second Fisherman
line: Canst thou catch any fishes, then?

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I never practised it.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: Second Fisherman
line: Nay, then thou wilt starve, sure; for here's nothing

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: Second Fisherman
line: to be got now-a-days, unless thou canst fish for't.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: What I have been I have forgot to know;

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: But what I am, want teaches me to think on:

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: A man throng'd up with cold: my veins are chill,

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And have no more of life than may suffice

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: To give my tongue that heat to ask your help;

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Which if you shall refuse, when I am dead,

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: For that I am a man, pray see me buried.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: First Fisherman
line: Die quoth-a? Now gods forbid! I have a gown here;

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: First Fisherman
line: come, put it on; keep thee warm. Now, afore me, a

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: First Fisherman
line: handsome fellow! Come, thou shalt go home, and

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: First Fisherman
line: we'll have flesh for holidays, fish for

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: First Fisherman
line: fasting-days, and moreo'er puddings and flap-jacks,

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: First Fisherman
line: and thou shalt be welcome.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I thank you, sir.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: Second Fisherman
line: Hark you, my friend; you said you could not beg.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I did but crave.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: Second Fisherman
line: But crave! Then I'll turn craver too, and so I

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: Second Fisherman
line: shall 'scape whipping.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Why, are all your beggars whipped, then?

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: Second Fisherman
line: O, not all, my friend, not all; for if all your

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: Second Fisherman
line: beggars were whipped, I would wish no better office

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: Second Fisherman
line: than to be beadle. But, master, I'll go draw up the

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: Second Fisherman
line: net.

speaker: PERICLES
line: Aside  How well this honest mirth becomes their labour!

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: First Fisherman
line: Hark you, sir, do you know where ye are?

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Not well.

speaker: First Fisherman
line: Why, I'll tell you: this is called Pentapolis, and

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: our king the good Simonides.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: The good King Simonides, do you call him.

line: Ay, sir; and he deserves so to be called for his

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: He is a happy king, since he gains from his subjects

line: the name of good by his government. How far is his

line: court distant from this shore?

line: Marry, sir, half a day's journey: and I'll tell

speaker: First Fisherman
line: you, he hath a fair daughter, and to-morrow is her

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: birth-day; and there are princes and knights come

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: from all parts of the world to just and tourney for her love.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Were my fortunes equal to my desires, I could wish

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: to make one there.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: First Fisherman
line: O, sir, things must be as they may; and what a man

line: cannot get, he may lawfully deal for--his wife's soul.

line: like a poor man's right in the law; 'twill hardly

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.

line: come out. Ha! bots on't, 'tis come at last, and

line: 'tis turned to a rusty armour.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
speaker: PERICLES
line: An armour, friends! I pray you, let me see it.

scene: SCENE I.  Pentapolis. An open place by the sea-side.
