scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: What, are you merry, knights?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: Knights
line: Who can be other in this royal presence?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Here, with a cup that's stored unto the brim,--

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: As you do love, fill to your mistress' lips,--

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: We drink this health to you.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: KNIGHTS
line: We thank your grace.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Yet pause awhile:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Yon knight doth sit too melancholy,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: As if the entertainment in our court

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Had not a show might countervail his worth.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Note it not you, Thaisa?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: What is it

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: To me, my father?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: O, attend, my daughter:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Princes in this should live like gods above,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Who freely give to every one that comes

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: To honour them:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: And princes not doing so are like to gnats,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Which make a sound, but kill'd are wonder'd at.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Therefore to make his entrance more sweet,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Here, say we drink this standing-bowl of wine to him.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: Alas, my father, it befits not me

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: Unto a stranger knight to be so bold:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: He may my proffer take for an offence,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: Since men take women's gifts for impudence.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: How!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Do as I bid you, or you'll move me else.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: Aside  Now, by the gods, he could not please me better.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: And furthermore tell him, we desire to know of him,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Of whence he is, his name and parentage.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: The king my father, sir, has drunk to you.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I thank him.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: Wishing it so much blood unto your life.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I thank both him and you, and pledge him freely.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: And further he desires to know of you,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: Of whence you are, your name and parentage.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: PERICLES
line: A gentleman of Tyre; my name, Pericles;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: PERICLES
line: My education been in arts and arms;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Who, looking for adventures in the world,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Was by the rough seas reft of ships and men,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: PERICLES
line: And after shipwreck driven upon this shore.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: He thanks your grace; names himself Pericles,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: A gentleman of Tyre,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: Who only by misfortune of the seas

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: THAISA
line: Bereft of ships and men, cast on this shore.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Now, by the gods, I pity his misfortune,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: And will awake him from his melancholy.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Come, gentlemen, we sit too long on trifles,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: And waste the time, which looks for other revels.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Even in your armours, as you are address'd,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Will very well become a soldier's dance.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: I will not have excuse, with saying this

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Loud music is too harsh for ladies' heads,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Since they love men in arms as well as beds.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: So, this was well ask'd,'twas so well perform'd.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Come, sir;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Here is a lady that wants breathing too:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: And I have heard, you knights of Tyre

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Are excellent in making ladies trip;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: And that their measures are as excellent.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: PERICLES
line: In those that practise them they are, my lord.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: O, that's as much as you would be denied

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Of your fair courtesy.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Unclasp, unclasp:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Thanks, gentlemen, to all; all have done well.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: But you the best. Pages and lights, to conduct

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: These knights unto their several lodgings!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Yours, sir,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: We have given order to be next our own.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I am at your grace's pleasure.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Princes, it is too late to talk of love;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: And that's the mark I know you level at:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Therefore each one betake him to his rest;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: To-morrow all for speeding do their best.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: No, Escanes, know this of me,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Antiochus from incest lived not free:

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: For which, the most high gods not minding longer

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: To withhold the vengeance that they had in store,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Due to this heinous capital offence,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Even in the height and pride of all his glory,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: When he was seated in a chariot

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Of an inestimable value, and his daughter with him,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: A fire from heaven came and shrivell'd up

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Their bodies, even to loathing; for they so stunk,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: That all those eyes adored them ere their fall

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Scorn now their hand should give them burial.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: ESCANES
line: 'Twas very strange.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: And yet but justice; for though

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: This king were great, his greatness was no guard

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: To bar heaven's shaft, but sin had his reward.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: ESCANES
line: 'Tis very true.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: See, not a man in private conference

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: Or council has respect with him but he.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: It shall no longer grieve without reproof.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Third Lord
line: And cursed be he that will not second it.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: Follow me, then. Lord Helicane, a word.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: With me? and welcome: happy day, my lords.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: Know that our griefs are risen to the top,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: And now at length they overflow their banks.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Your griefs! for what? wrong not your prince you love.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: Wrong not yourself, then, noble Helicane;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: But if the prince do live, let us salute him,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: Or know what ground's made happy by his breath.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: If in the world he live, we'll seek him out;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: If in his grave he rest, we'll find him there;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: And be resolved he lives to govern us,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: Or dead, give's cause to mourn his funeral,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: And leave us to our free election.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Whose death indeed's the strongest in our censure:

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: And knowing this kingdom is without a head,--

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Like goodly buildings left without a roof

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Soon fall to ruin,--your noble self,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: That best know how to rule and how to reign,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: Second Lord
line: We thus submit unto,--our sovereign.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: All
line: Live, noble Helicane!

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: For honour's cause, forbear your suffrages:

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: If that you love Prince Pericles, forbear.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Take I your wish, I leap into the seas,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Where's hourly trouble for a minute's ease.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: A twelvemonth longer, let me entreat you to

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Forbear the absence of your king:

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: If in which time expired, he not return,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: I shall with aged patience bear your yoke.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: But if I cannot win you to this love,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Go search like nobles, like noble subjects,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: And in your search spend your adventurous worth;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Whom if you find, and win unto return,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: You shall like diamonds sit about his crown.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: To wisdom he's a fool that will not yield;

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: And since Lord Helicane enjoineth us,

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: First Lord
line: We with our travels will endeavour us.

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: Then you love us, we you, and we'll clasp hands:

scene: SCENE IV.  Tyre. A room in the Governor's house.
speaker: HELICANUS
line: When peers thus knit, a kingdom ever stands.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: First Knight
line: Good morrow to the good Simonides.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Knights, from my daughter this I let you know,

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: That for this twelvemonth she'll not undertake

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: A married life.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Her reason to herself is only known,

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Which yet from her by no means can I get.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: Second Knight
line: May we not get access to her, my lord?

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: 'Faith, by no means; she has so strictly tied

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Her to her chamber, that 'tis impossible.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: One twelve moons more she'll wear Diana's livery;

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: This by the eye of Cynthia hath she vow'd

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: And on her virgin honour will not break it.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: Third Knight
line: Loath to bid farewell, we take our leaves.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: So,

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: They are well dispatch'd; now to my daughter's letter:

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: She tells me here, she'd wed the stranger knight,

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Or never more to view nor day nor light.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: 'Tis well, mistress; your choice agrees with mine;

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: I like that well: nay, how absolute she's in't,

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Not minding whether I dislike or no!

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Well, I do commend her choice;

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: And will no longer have it be delay'd.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Soft! here he comes: I must dissemble it.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: All fortune to the good Simonides!

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: To you as much, sir! I am beholding to you

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: For your sweet music this last night: I do

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Protest my ears were never better fed

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: With such delightful pleasing harmony.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: It is your grace's pleasure to commend;

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Not my desert.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Sir, you are music's master.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: The worst of all her scholars, my good lord.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Let me ask you one thing:

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: What do you think of my daughter, sir?

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: A most virtuous princess.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: And she is fair too, is she not?

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: As a fair day in summer, wondrous fair.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Sir, my daughter thinks very well of you;

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Ay, so well, that you must be her master,

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: And she will be your scholar: therefore look to it.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: I am unworthy for her schoolmaster.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: She thinks not so; peruse this writing else.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Aside  What's here?

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: A letter, that she loves the knight of Tyre!

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: 'Tis the king's subtlety to have my life.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: O, seek not to entrap me, gracious lord,

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: A stranger and distressed gentleman,

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: That never aim'd so high to love your daughter,

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: But bent all offices to honour her.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Thou hast bewitch'd my daughter, and thou art

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: A villain.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: By the gods, I have not:

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Never did thought of mine levy offence;

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Nor never did my actions yet commence

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: A deed might gain her love or your displeasure.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Traitor, thou liest.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Traitor!

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: SIMONIDES
line: Ay, traitor.

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES
line: Even in his throat--unless it be the king--

scene: SCENE V.  Pentapolis. A room in the palace.
speaker: PERICLES

speaker: MARINA
line: I never spake bad word, nor did ill turn

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: To any living creature: believe me, la,

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: I never kill'd a mouse, nor hurt a fly:

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: I trod upon a worm against my will,

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: But I wept for it. How have I offended,

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: Wherein my death might yield her any profit,

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: Or my life imply her any danger?

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: LEONINE
line: My commission

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: LEONINE
line: Is not to reason of the deed, but do it.

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: You will not do't for all the world, I hope.

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: You are well favour'd, and your looks foreshow

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: You have a gentle heart. I saw you lately,

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: When you caught hurt in parting two that fought:

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: Good sooth, it show'd well in you: do so now:

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: Your lady seeks my life; come you between,

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: MARINA
line: And save poor me, the weaker.

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: LEONINE
line: I am sworn,

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: LEONINE
line: And will dispatch.

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: First Pirate
line: Hold, villain!

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: Second Pirate
line: A prize! a prize!

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: Third Pirate
line: Half-part, mates, half-part.

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: Third Pirate
line: Come, let's have her aboard suddenly.

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: LEONINE
line: These roguing thieves serve the great pirate Valdes;

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: LEONINE
line: And they have seized Marina. Let her go:

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: LEONINE
line: There's no hope she will return. I'll swear

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: LEONINE
line: she's dead,

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: LEONINE
line: And thrown into the sea. But I'll see further:

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: LEONINE
line: Perhaps they will but please themselves upon her,

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: LEONINE
line: Not carry her aboard. If she remain,

scene: SCENE I.  Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.
speaker: LEONINE
line: Whom they have ravish'd must by me be slain.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: Boult!

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: Sir?

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: Search the market narrowly; Mytilene is full of

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: gallants. We lost too much money this mart by being

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: too wenchless.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: We were never so much out of creatures. We have but

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: poor three, and they can do no more than they can

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: do; and they with continual action are even as good as rotten.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: Therefore let's have fresh ones, whate'er we pay for

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: them. If there be not a conscience to be used in

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: every trade, we shall never prosper.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Thou sayest true: 'tis not our bringing up of poor

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: bastards,--as, I think, I have brought up some eleven--

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: Ay, to eleven; and brought them down again. But

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: shall I search the market?

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: What else, man? The stuff we have, a strong wind

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: will blow it to pieces, they are so pitifully sodden.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: Thou sayest true; they're too unwholesome, o'

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: conscience. The poor Transylvanian is dead, that

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: lay with the little baggage.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: Ay, she quickly pooped him; she made him roast-meat

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: for worms. But I'll go search the market.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: Three or four thousand chequins were as pretty a

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: proportion to live quietly, and so give over.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Why to give over, I pray you? is it a shame to get

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: when we are old?

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: O, our credit comes not in like the commodity, nor

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: the commodity wages not with the danger: therefore,

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: if in our youths we could pick up some pretty

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: estate, 'twere not amiss to keep our door hatched.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: Besides, the sore terms we stand upon with the gods

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: will be strong with us for giving over.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Come, other sorts offend as well as we.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: As well as we! ay, and better too; we offend worse.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: Neither is our profession any trade; it's no

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: calling. But here comes Boult.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: To MARINA  Come your ways. My masters, you say

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: she's a virgin?

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: First Pirate
line: O, sir, we doubt it not.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: Master, I have gone through for this piece, you see:

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: if you like her, so; if not, I have lost my earnest.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Boult, has she any qualities?

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: She has a good face, speaks well, and has excellent

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: good clothes: there's no further necessity of

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: qualities can make her be refused.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: What's her price, Boult?

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: I cannot be bated one doit of a thousand pieces.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: Well, follow me, my masters, you shall have your

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: money presently. Wife, take her in; instruct her

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: what she has to do, that she may not be raw in her

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Pandar
line: entertainment.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Boult, take you the marks of her, the colour of her

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: hair, complexion, height, age, with warrant of her

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: virginity; and cry 'He that will give most shall

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: have her first.' Such a maidenhead were no cheap

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: thing, if men were as they have been. Get this done

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: as I command you.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: Performance shall follow.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: Alack that Leonine was so slack, so slow!

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: He should have struck, not spoke; or that these pirates,

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: Not enough barbarous, had not o'erboard thrown me

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: For to seek my mother!

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Why lament you, pretty one?

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: That I am pretty.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Come, the gods have done their part in you.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: I accuse them not.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: You are light into my hands, where you are like to live.

speaker: MARINA
line: The more my fault

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: To scape his hands where I was like to die.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Ay, and you shall live in pleasure.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: No.

line: Yes, indeed shall you, and taste gentlemen of all

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: fashions: you shall fare well; you shall have the

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: difference of all complexions. What! do you stop your ears?

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: Are you a woman?

line: What would you have me be, an I be not a woman?

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.

line: An honest woman, or not a woman.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Marry, whip thee, gosling: I think I shall have

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: something to do with you. Come, you're a young

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: foolish sapling, and must be bowed as I would have

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: you.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: The gods defend me!

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.

line: If it please the gods to defend you by men, then men

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.

speaker: Bawd
line: you up. Boult's returned.

line: Now, sir, hast thou cried her through the market?

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: I have cried her almost to the number of her hairs;

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: I have drawn her picture with my voice.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: And I prithee tell me, how dost thou find the

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: inclination of the people, especially of the younger sort?

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: 'Faith, they listened to me as they would have

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: hearkened to their father's testament. There was a

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT

speaker: BOULT
line: her very description.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: We shall have him here to-morrow with his best ruff on.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: To-night, to-night. But, mistress, do you know the

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: French knight that cowers i' the hams?

line: Who, Monsieur Veroles?

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: Ay, he: he offered to cut a caper at the

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: proclamation; but he made a groan at it, and swore

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.

line: he would see her to-morrow.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: sun.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: Well, if we had of every nation a traveller, we

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: should lodge them with this sign.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: To MARINA  Pray you, come hither awhile. You

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: have fortunes coming upon you. Mark me: you must

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: seem to do that fearfully which you commit

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: willingly, despise profit where you have most gain.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: To weep that you live as ye do makes pity in your

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: lovers: seldom but that pity begets you a good

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: opinion, and that opinion a mere profit.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: I understand you not.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: O, take her home, mistress, take her home: these

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: blushes of hers must be quenched with some present practise.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.

line: Thou sayest true, i' faith, so they must; for your

line: bride goes to that with shame which is her way to go

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: with warrant.

speaker: BOULT
line: 'Faith, some do, and some do not. But, mistress, if

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: I have bargained for the joint,--

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Thou mayst cut a morsel off the spit.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: I may so.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Who should deny it? Come, young one, I like the

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: manner of your garments well.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: Ay, by my faith, they shall not be changed yet.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Boult, spend thou that in the town: report what a

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: sojourner we have; you'll lose nothing by custom.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: When nature flamed this piece, she meant thee a good

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.

line: turn; therefore say what a paragon she is, and thou

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: hast the harvest out of thine own report.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.

line: I warrant you, mistress, thunder shall not so awake

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.

line: the beds of eels as my giving out her beauty stir up

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: BOULT
line: the lewdly-inclined. I'll bring home some to-night.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: Bawd
line: Come your ways; follow me.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: If fires be hot, knives sharp, or waters deep,

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.

line: Untied I still my virgin knot will keep.

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.
speaker: MARINA
line: Diana, aid my purpose!

scene: SCENE II.  Mytilene. A room in a brothel.

line: The sun and moon ne'er look'd upon!

speaker: DIONYZA
line: I think

line: You'll turn a child again.

scene: SCENE III.  Tarsus. A room in CLEON's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Were I chief lord of all this spacious world,

line: I'ld give it to undo the deed. O lady,

line: Much less in blood than virtue, yet a princess

speaker: CLEON
line: To equal any single crown o' the earth

speaker: CLEON
line: I' the justice of compare! O villain Leonine!

scene: SCENE III.  Tarsus. A room in CLEON's house.
speaker: CLEON
line: Whom thou hast poison'd too:

speaker: CLEON
line: If thou hadst drunk to him, 't had been a kindness

line: Becoming well thy fact: what canst thou say

line: When noble Pericles shall demand his child?

line: That she is dead. Nurses are not the fates,

line: She died at night; I'll say so. Who can cross it?

speaker: DIONYZA
line: Unless you play the pious innocent,

scene: SCENE III.  Tarsus. A room in CLEON's house.

line: And for an honest attribute cry out

line: 'She died by foul play.'

speaker: CLEON
line: O, go to. Well, well,
